parts.text:
[Statement 1]: No studies have been found that evaluated the effects on bat populations of training arborists and forestry operatives to identify potential bat roosts.
[Statement 2]: No studies have been found that evaluated the effects on bat populations of protecting roost trees during forest operations.
[Statement 3]: There is currently no evidence available to assess whether training arborists and forestry operatives to identify potential bat roosts is effective or has any harmful impacts.
[Statement 4]: There is currently no evidence available to assess whether protecting roost trees during forest operations is effective or has any harmful impacts.
[Statement 5]: No comparison of effectiveness between training arborists to identify potential bat roosts and protecting roost trees during forest operations can be made based on the available evidence.

key: _claude-sonnet-4__Will training arborists to identify potential bat roosts (Action 1981) be more effective than protecting known roost trees during forest operations (Action 1982)?
